title: Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description:
Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997 [details]: NioEndpoint.java and simple web application

Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until it is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with Java versions 1.6.007, 1.6.018, and 1.6.021. It is a duplicate of issue: Bug 46373. It seems that the Jetty team has fixed this problem as mentioned in their JIRA ticket: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel. I have added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: The server's CPU reaches 100% and remains at 100% until it is restarted.
EB: The server's CPU usage should not reach 100% and should not stay at 100% indefinitely.
SR: To reproduce the JVM bug, perform multiple requests (e.g., press F5 in the browser and hold the button) to the web application.
